intro: Trichanthecium noterophilum, commonly known as the narrowleaf false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant has slender, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late spring to early summer. Trichanthecium noterophilum is typically found in moist, open habitats such as prairies and woodland edges.
